191e8df48f2c11a46970caae1f5f94be (20:44): ok guys need help - My server is a dual xeon 2gig ram with scsi disk - I am pushing 10Mbit/s of BW of large video files - and my load is at 12 with iowait of 35% and nothing reporting in top. Any help I would appreciate please.
1af7c8197e4cc12ccc15daff7294459b (20:44): i mean, restore the packages
7d00bd05e77c8c8be674614c21440f34 (20:44): bad question?
f4ea20ae05d2da565e774193265e2df2 (20:44): more specifically, i dont want to just stream some mp3s, i want any audio playing on my linux box to play on my windows laptop.
c7be4bf0331136d8d33f7f3da4b4d557 (20:44): Adriaan: emerge -K <list of pkgs>
620cc67bc78667a9f9eceaeca6517df1 (20:45): mikefoo: Get more RAM
1af7c8197e4cc12ccc15daff7294459b (20:45): kojiro, can is save the packages to another disk?
620cc67bc78667a9f9eceaeca6517df1 (20:45): And if possible, use another web server than Apache
620cc67bc78667a9f9eceaeca6517df1 (20:45): Apache uses a lot of CPU per pageload.
c7be4bf0331136d8d33f7f3da4b4d557 (20:45): Adriaan: yes. The important thing is that when you do emerge -K, portage knows where to find the packages
8f50b0a89667ff023ed42c70abbb636d (20:45): is there a way to see what my machine is doing via ssh
620cc67bc78667a9f9eceaeca6517df1 (20:45): GeorgeA_Work: top ?
1af7c8197e4cc12ccc15daff7294459b (20:46): kojiro, even if they are on another disk :S?
7d00bd05e77c8c8be674614c21440f34 (20:46): anyone use nfs? how do i get locking?
8f50b0a89667ff023ed42c70abbb636d (20:46): like if it's done emerging gnome?
c7be4bf0331136d8d33f7f3da4b4d557 (20:46): Adriaan: as long as portage can read that disk
56bc679cc5b6ce0d18645b8a98f89f8f (20:46): Why does gnome 2.14 see my drives as removable media?
620cc67bc78667a9f9eceaeca6517df1 (20:46): GeorgeA_Work: Do top and see if there's a process taking up 99% CPU
620cc67bc78667a9f9eceaeca6517df1 (20:46): If you see that your load is 0 and nothing is happening, it's probably done or an error occured.
c7be4bf0331136d8d33f7f3da4b4d557 (20:46): Adriaan: you need to set PKGDIR in make.conf to wherever those packages are
c7be4bf0331136d8d33f7f3da4b4d557 (20:47): Adriaan: assuming it's mounted properly and readable by portage, then there's no problem using another disk
